image.altText: A woman in a khaki button-down wiping off the leaves of a palm in a tropical greenhouse.

props.synopsis: For about two hours every week, the Squishy Vols, as they're known, meet for some meditative manual labour to squish bugs and scrape scale from plants in the glasshouses at the Australian National Botanic Gardens in Canberra.

title.children: These volunteers are searching for malicious pests in a bid to preserve treasured Australian plants

image.altText: a woman sitting on an outdoor couch in a brightly-patterned top next to a brown border collie

props.synopsis: It's a far from uncommon situation. But what can you actually do if the neighbour's dog just won't stop barking?

title.children: How to deal with a neighbour's nuisance barking dog (and keep things cordial)

image.altText: Two police officers walk near the scene of the collision in Kambah.

props.synopsis: A 75-year-old woman has died after a single vehicle crash in Canberra's south.

title.children: Woman dies after single vehicle crash in Canberra parking lot

image.altText: a woman sets a table in a restaurant

props.synopsis: Caitlin Baker is an accomplished sommelier, but that doesn't mean she's always treated respectfully by customers or colleagues.

title.children: 'I want to talk to a man': Female hospitality workers call out sexism

image.altText: A white man runs with a group of Thai children, all are wearing yellow shirts. One kid is high fiving the man.

props.synopsis: After the 2004 Boxing Day tsunami, forensic investigator Peter Baines wanted to create good from the enormity of loss. Twenty years on, he has raised $30 million for children orphaned by the disaster.

title.children: The forensic officer who changed lives after 2004 Boxing Day tsunami

image.altText: An old black-and-white image of soldiers in world war one.

props.synopsis: A veterans' group in regional NSW is searching for stories of First Nations soldiers who fought for Australia to finally give them the recognition they deserve.

title.children: Aunty Cheryl has found the 'lost' history of her Indigenous Anzac ancestors

image.altText: Concept art of a sports club.

props.synopsis: A proposed club from Vikings Group with 160 poker machines has been met with criticism from a community group and anti-gambling advocates in the NSW region.

title.children: Club with 160 poker machines proposed for Jerrabomberra

image.altText: An Australian runner leads a group of runners across the line in her Olympic heat.

props.synopsis: Athletics made the headlines in Australia multiple times in 2024 because the athletes stepped up to another level, catching the attention and the imagination of the nation.

title.children: 2024 a great year for Australian athletics, and all signs point to it getting better

image.altText: Busy Main Beach at Noosa in January 2022

props.synopsis: Summer is a bumper time of year for coastal communities, but not every town is happy with the influx of holiday crowds as pollution, traffic and waste put a strain on local infrastructure.

title.children: Tourists have been flocking to an idyllic coastal getaway. The council has been asking them to stay away

image.altText: A close up of a blonde woman's face

props.synopsis: In a social media ecosystem already rife with misogyny, racism and aggression, experts say it's remarkably easy to shape the narrative around a public figure through "astroturfing".

title.children: Blake Lively is not the first star to allegedly be targeted by 'astroturfing'

image.altText: A drone view shows the crash site of an Azerbaijan Airlines passenger plane near the city of Aktau

props.synopsis: An Azerbaijan Airlines flight that crashed in Kazakhstan was downed by a Russian air defence system, four sources in Azerbaijan with knowledge of the investigation say.

title.children: Sources claim Azerbaijan Airlines flight downed by Russian air defense system

image.altText: A white van with red letters reading "PRESS" on its back doors, browned and covered in smoke, with two people standing nearby

props.synopsis: Israel's National Security Minister Itamar Ben Gvir visited Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque compound on Thursday, sparking condemnation from the Palestinian Authority and Jordan.

title.children: Five Palestinian journalists reportedly killed in Gaza air strikes

image.altText: Photo of nuclear power station chimneys

props.synopsis: One of Australia's closest neighbours proposes 29 locations for nuclear power plants across the archipelago, but critics say the plan is "dangerous".

title.children: Concerns over Indonesia's nuclear power plans as 29 sites proposed

image.altText: Composite image of Sam Konstas, Marnus Labuschagne and Virat Kohli on day one of the MCG Test between Australia and India.

props.synopsis: Sam Konstas takes on Jasprit Bumrah and Virat Kohli, Shane Warne is remembered and Marnus Labuschagne is in the wars on Boxing Day. Here are the quick hits from day one of the fourth Test between Australia and India.

title.children: Quick hits: Konstas captivates and Warnie is honoured on Boxing Day

image.altText: A group of people running out of a boardered off area.

props.synopsis: Police say protests at the prison led to the collapse of a wall which allowed the inmates to flee.

title.children: At least 6,000 prisoners escape maximum security prison in Mozambique

image.altText: new york yellow taxi front end smashed and police tape covering the scene

props.synopsis: A total of seven people were reportedly injured in the incident that occurred outside a Macy's department store in midtown Manhattan.

title.children: Two Australians reportedly injured after New York taxi veers into pedestrians

image.altText: Two people in beds in an Afghan hospital hooked up to drips.

props.synopsis: Bombardment by Pakistani military aircraft in Afghanistan's eastern Paktika province kills at least 46 people, most of whom are children and women, according to the Taliban.

title.children: Taliban vows retribution after Pakistani air strikes kill 46 people

image.altText: Images of an elderly woman wearing a white shirt, holding her phone as she sits at her kitchen table. Her face is hidden.

props.synopsis: With millions of dollars lost in NSW alone, one investigator says it's often the family of romance fraud victims who reach out for support on their behalf.

title.children: 'They're ruthless': Katie never thought a dating scam would impact her family

image.altText: Yellow signs on the glass door of a bottle shop saying CLOSED

props.synopsis: A US election, an unprecedented tech outage, and living the Italian dream. 2024 was also the year multiple tragedies gripped the nation.

title.children: A US election, a global tech outage and living the Italian dream: Your most read ABC News stories in 2024

image.altText: An aerial view of a town

props.synopsis: There are calls for the Northern Territory to scrap a tiered building system that makes it legal to build a home that fails to meet national safety and liveability standards. And a housing expert says it wouldn't cost much to make the change.

title.children: In the remote NT your house may not be built to code — and it's legal

image.altText: A composite of Chris Crewther, Brad Battin and Jess Wilson

props.synopsis: Victorian Opposition Leader John Pesutto is facing a leadership challenge this morning, after a group of shadow ministers called a special meeting of the Liberal party room.

title.children: Three Victorian Liberals throw hat in the ring to contest leadership

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian sharemarket is set to open higher despite a mediocre session on Wall Street, while uncertainties around President-elect Donald Trump's policies lift gold prices. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX to rise as Wall Street ends flat, gold jumps on demand

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Wall Street rises, benchmark US yield ekes out new high

image.altText: Influencer Tim Abbott takes a selfie while lying on the sand at the beach on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: We share some tips from influencer Tim Abbott, along with several other people we have spoken to as part of our Unwind with... series, about switching off digitally these holidays.

title.children: How to switch off digitally these holidays to be present

image.altText: Illustration of boats in a harbour, with small village on hill behind, circa 1800.

props.synopsis: When Senator Lidia Thorpe shouted to King Charles that "this is not your land" she highlighted the issue of theft, and Australia's very complicated history with it.

title.children: In a world of disadvantage and exploitation, is stealing always wrong?

image.altText: The side of a police car with the logo and word Police.

props.synopsis: A man will face court today after allegedly shooting a firearm at a vehicle during a roadside incident in Queensland's Scenic Rim region.

title.children: Queensland man charged over alleged roadside shooting

image.altText: Chelsea, Demi and Joel Holloway stand together holding up shirts and revealing their surgery scars on abdomen.

props.synopsis: Three Adelaide siblings say their lives have changed forever after undergoing pancreas removal — and they're wearing their scars with pride.

title.children: 'Ticking time bomb': Adelaide siblings undergo rare procedure to remove their pancreas

image.altText: jet skis and divers search for a missing boy at North Avoca Beach

props.synopsis: Police say it is unlikely a 15-year-old boy will be found alive after he was swept into the sea from rocks on the NSW Central Coast on Christmas Eve.

title.children: Family's anguish as search for 'perfect son' becomes a recovery operation

image.altText: Joe Biden in a blue suit shaking hands and smiling with Volodomyr Zelensky wearing an olive green top

props.synopsis: The outgoing US president has ordered weapons deliveries for Kyiv to continue on the same day Russia launched a Christmas missile attack on Ukrainian energy infrastructure.

title.children: Biden directs US to keep giving Ukraine weapons after Russian strikes

image.altText: Bear cub holding red ball in sanctuary

props.synopsis: Zookeepers and volunteers have returned to Sydney from a Laotian bear sanctuary after working with vulnerable cubs rescued from the illegal wildlife trade.

title.children: What life looks like for rescued bear cubs saved from trafficking

image.altText: A white and blue United Airlines Boeing 787-10 Dreamliner plane mid-takeoff above other planes and a brown landscape

props.synopsis: The Boeing 787-10 had flown from Chicago to the Hawaiian island, and the airline says it remains unclear how or when the person accessed the wheel well.

title.children: Body found in wheel well of United Airlines plane in Maui

image.altText: A burnt out store

props.synopsis: A manhunt is underway after an alleged firebombing and assault occurred at a Brisbane tobacco store Thursday morning.

title.children: Police hunting for male suspect after Brisbane tobacco store attack

image.altText: Two boys and a man shaking hands in celebration.

props.synopsis: The LNP has earmarked $80 million for six crime prevention and youth justice schools across the state, which are expected to teach 900 young people at risk of criminal offending. But they won't be up and running until 2026.

title.children: 'I felt a connection': What crime prevention schools look like in practice

image.altText: A a silver SUV and police car parked outside a two-story house, which is cordoned off with police tape.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged with murder over the death of a woman in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Man charged with murder of woman in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: Gi-hun has a crazed, desolate expression in his eyes as he stares at something off-camera while surrounded by other players.

props.synopsis: Here's your Squid Game refresher as the dystopian horror that captured imaginations around the world returns for its penultimate season.

title.children: Time for another round of Red Light, Green Light: Squid Game is back
